programme.title: Hangin' With the Homeboys
programme.desc: Willie (Doug E. Doug), Tom (Mario Joyner), Johnny (John Leguizamo) and Vinny are fast-talkers from the South Bronx looking for a party.

programme.title: Krush Groove
programme.desc: Desperate to start his own company, a record producer (Blair Underwood) unwisely borrows from a loan shark (Lisa Gay Hamilton).

programme.title: Under the Cherry Moon
programme.desc: News of a trust-fund beauty (Kristin Scott Thomas) inspires the pianist (Prince) at a hotel in Nice on the Riviera.

programme.title: Graffiti Bridge
programme.desc: The Kid (Prince) and his rock-club rival (Morris Day) disagree about music in a sequel to the 1984 film "Purple Rain."

programme.title: Bruce's Deadly Fingers
programme.desc: Malicious gangsters capture Bruce's former girlfriend, then a young martial artist attempts to rescue her and the late master's book containing lethal techniques for killing with a finger.

programme.title: The Dragon Lives
programme.desc: Tracing Bruce Lee's life from college to his fascination with martial arts and development of Jeet Kune Do to his untimely death.

programme.title: Betty: They Say I'm Different
programme.desc: Betty Davis arrives on the '70s scene to break boundaries for women with her daring personality and outrageous funk music. She then, despite being banned and boycotted, goes on to become the first black woman to perform, write and manage herself.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Author Chester Himes is welcomed back from self-exile in Europe; actor Al Freeman Jr. reads from Himes' autobiography; The Dells.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.sub-title: Harry Belafonte; Novella Nelson; Sidney Poitier
programme.desc: Sidney Poitier and Harry Belafonte discuss their new film, "Buck and the Preacher"; Novella Nelson.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Ruby Dee and Ossie Davis, aided by the music of composer-saxophonist Lucky Thompson, give dramatic readings of the poetry of a writer named Robert Cornell Kaufman.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: The songwriting/performing duo Nick Ashford and Valerie Simpson.

programme.title: Rock and Roll Revue
programme.desc: Vintage clips of great jazz artists.

programme.title: Adios Amigo
programme.desc: A frontier con man (Richard Pryor) tries scams that never work, leaving his partner (Fred Williamson) behind to explain.

programme.title: Joshua
programme.desc: Men who return home from the Civil War with hopes of rebuilding their lives find death and destruction.

programme.title: Knightriders
programme.desc: George Romero's unusual story of a modern-day Renaissance troupe whose participants follow a medieval code of honor.

programme.title: A Piece of the Action
programme.desc: Two con men (Sidney Poitier, Bill Cosby) are persuaded by a retired policeman (James Earl Jones) to volunteer their services to a ghetto youth center.
